name: places/ChIJb7CqrvpZwokRFeC0MqXi7ys
adrFormatAddress: 250 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: The dining soars like an opera house, with three-tiered chandeliers hanging from the double-height ceiling and a balcony row of box-seat tables. Seating is on royal blue banquettes and gold armchairs; tablecloths are white, and are freshly ironed just before you sit down. As for service, there is a whole lot of it, with dark-suited servers hastening this way and that.

text.text: The dining soars like an opera house, with three-tiered chandeliers hanging from the double-height ceiling and a balcony row of box-seat tables. Seating is on royal blue banquettes and gold armchairs; tablecloths are white, and are freshly ironed just before you sit down. As for service, there is a whole lot of it, with dark-suited servers hastening this way and that.

originalText.text:
New York City has been crying out for an amazing restaurant place with a good vibe. Attentive but never thirsty service from Jake and the panoply of perfect staff made a fantastic meal memorable. The menu just right, curated drinks a lovely compliment to the fayre. An NYC version of The Ivy or Rules. Feast on the photos and make the effort, they will more than return the compliment to you and your guests. Fancy but not fussy.

Be aware that the sticky toffee pudding is boozy as heck!

originalText.text:
My favorite restaurant in 2023!
Service was over the top, amazing food, and beautiful atmosphere.
We loved all the dishes we ordered but truffle lasagna was my favorite. We made our next reservation again here while we were at the restaurant even before we got the checkðŸ¤£

+
Went back this weekend (01/12/2024) Such a lovely staffs they remembered us from the last time we came and provided excellent service again!

originalText.text:
Very beautiful inside. Great design. Loved bathroom more than my risotto.
We went for family dinner. I am vegetarian. They gave poor selection. The size of butternut squash risotto was so small and pair with salad which was tasty.
Risotto didnâ€™t remind me Italian risotto at all, the size was too small even for me almost no fat girl. So for men who likes big size food donâ€™t order risotto.
Other dishes were better size. Good food, not salty caviar on top of lobster of my husbands dish. Though he enjoyed the dish.

Wouldnâ€™t recommend for vegetarians/vegans. They have gluten free bread.

originalText.text:
A beautiful restaurant with warm and welcoming staff, plenty of room to spread out, a moderate noise level, a lovely dining room and bar and, of course, great food.

The host and hostess are delightful.  The bartenders are kind and helpful, the wait staff is professional, friendly and efficient and the overall service is excellent.

Tried the beef carpaccio and shrimp colonatta for appetizers and they were delicious.  Had the risotto with white truffles. Out of this world.  Had the beef fillet and it was wonderful. Was not crazy about the diver sole preparation but otherwise fabulous as was the pistachio ice cream.

All in all an extremely good dining experience and Iâ€™ll be back!
